comment: 15 Quizzes, 2 Discussions, 4 Journals. The course is out of 100 points, and the final paper was 10 points. It was a maymester, so you should really be staying ahead so you don't miss anything. He is very supportive and wants you to pass! It's really all about being a good student. TAKE HIM!!!! (He also provides the textbook)

Easy class. Textbook required. 2 quizzes every week, 4 exams total, 2 essays total - all are easy. Exams are lock down browser and webcam, but they are the exact same questions as quizzes, just randomized. Gives great feedback and lovely professor. I would recommend.

Dr.Mitchelson has to be one of my favorite professors I've had. He's very kind and I genuinely learned something while being in the class and he inspired me to possibly pursue a Geography minor! Course material was simple, if you attended class, you wouldn't have to take the quizzes. There's a paper during the second half of the semester that is ez
Very easy going professor and there was only one graded assignment the whole semester

Great professor! Grade is composed of discussion posts, short journals, weekly chapter quizzes, 3 exams, a midterm essay, and a final essay. He drops the lowest journal, lowest discussion post, and 3 lowest chapter quizzes. Quizzes are open book/notes, exams are closed-book and lockdown browser + camera, but gives helpful practice exams. Take him!!

Quizzes, 2 tests, some discussions and journals. Professor Mitchelson is very sincere and wants to see each student do well. This class is very fair, with several attempts on some assignments, and drops.
Excellent and thoughtful.
Nice professor. You read the book, watch the lecture, then take a quiz. You have journals and discussion boards. 2 essays. 4 exams. Overall an easy class, I would take it again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: the sweetest and most thorough professor I have ever had, a literal angel. I would take any class taught by him you are in for a treat!

i took this as a maymester, super easy if you keep up with the work. if you get a 100 on everything, you can skip the essay and still make an A (90). there was something to do every day, but that's obvious for maymester. take him, it was an easy class! please do it

No tests! Just easy quizzes and discussions, and there's also journals you have to do, but those are super easy! I didn't have to buy a textbook either, he provided scanned pictures of each chapter in each module! Definitely recommend taking him, I took him for a four week online course, and it was really easy!
Dr. Mitchelson is an excellent professor. This is the best class I have ever taken. Please take him you won't regret.
I legit made a 100 in this class it was so easy. He's also a really cool dude so it's not even a boring show up, sit through it, get your A type of class. Take this dude right now.

chapter quizzes, tests, discussions, and a couple of papers but grading is very clear. Put in effort and you should do well. Lectures can get off task often but he really really cares about his students!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment:
Professor Mitchelson is such a sweetie. We use textbook for discussion and journal so get them. Show up to class everyday and you will get rewarded at the end i promise. I did and i got to exempt my final test and essay.
grades are based on tests, quizzes, and journals. Easy A i promise. TAKE HIM

Not the most interesting most of the time, but Professor Mitchelson is THE nicest guy and professor. Get the textbook because it's used for ALL the quizzes. And, even better, he reuses the same quiz questions for the tests. A few discussions, papers, and journals. Very lenient and understanding, easily accessible over email! TAKE THIS PROF!!

Great Professor, even if you are horrible at writing, you will get an A. I got a 98 with working 80 Hours a week. Take this class before someone else takes your spot. Definitely will take this class again. Great topic and awesome dude.

Dr. Mitchelson is the best! His Maymester course was 15 open book/note quizzes with unlimited attempts, 4 journals, 2 discussion posts, and a final paper. The journals are 2 paragraphs on what you found interesting and discouraging. He replies to emails quickly and is genuinely passionate about geography. His kind nature is unmatched. He's a gem!

Take him! I had him for a Maymester which I was worried about being that the course is only 2 weeks. However, I could not have asked for a better professor. He was very clear about his grading criteria, and gave very encouraging feedback. He genuinely wants you to succeed. The work load wasn't bad, just read the textbook. Overall a very nice guy!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Always open to questions after class. Very patient with all students (admirably so with disruptive students). He is willing to work one-on-one with students to make sure they get the most out of their experience in his class. There was extra credit available, but only for those who attended class regularly. Loved his lectures, super caring guy.

One of the best teachers I had at KSU. He is very kind and genuinely cares about his students and their well being. He wants his students to be involved and build meaningful relationships outside of class unlike any other lecture where you sit with random people then leave. I wish he taught another subject just so I can take him again.

Attendance isn't mandatory, but show up. He is a ball of joy and his lectures are super captivating, and he genuinely appreciates class participation. Homework is pretty light: multi-attempt practice quizzes every week, sometimes a little extra, and two papers a semester. He gave me a $5 Starbucks gift card for being attentive in class. I love him!
Easy course, good scores can be obtained

Dr. Mitchelson is easily one of the best professors I have had at KSU. He actually cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He is very understanding and tries to make the lectures as engaging as possible. I'm not a geography major or anything like that but this class was definitely one of my favorites. Take him!

Our class was kind of disorganized but he is such a kind, understanding professor. You can learn a lot from this class if you do the work. One 5 page midterm paper, one 7 page final paper, 5 analyses, and weekly attendance/participation grades. Super easy and super engaging class! If you can take his class, take it.

He was an awesome professor! There were journals roughly every week which were graded very easily, quizzes that you had unlimited chances on, 3 tests in total with an optional fourth. All the tests were a combination of the chapter quizzes making it very easy. There were few projects in the class and he was very understanding. Lots of extra credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a great professor. Took his online class and was the most well structured class I had. While most students take this course as easy electives it doesnt take away from how great of a professor he is.

Great professor! Extremely nice, caring, and understanding. His class was easy, but effort was still required. If you pay attention in class (you do not have to go to every class though) and read a little of the textbook, the tests shouldn't be too bad. His lectures were a little boring but probably because it was 9:05am.

I took this as a maymester and he was great. 15 quizzes with unlimited attempts. 2 test with 2 attempts for each. 3 super easy journals and a discussion board. And one essay. Serious an easy class. The test are the same questions from the quizzes

One of the kindest professors! I took his Maymester (2 week course) and he was really doing everything he could for his students to succeed. The Maymester was 15 quizzes, 2 test, a couple discussion posts, journal entries (2 paragraphs), and an essay. The quiz questions were most of the same questions on the test. His class was great hes a gem

he really cares about the success of his students, his lectures were great because he was so engaging about the topics, class was not mandatory, as long as you put some effort in you will pass the class
TAKE HIM! very caring and understanding. I only showed up to class 3 times and managed to pass with an A. If you are going to do this, stay on top of your work.
He is really good with understand the stress of college and will move due dates to accommodate. he loves what he does and is a great professor!

His class is very easy and he is a nice enough guy. Because its a hybrid class, there are practice quizzes (using lockdown browser) and journals due at the end of nearly every week. 3 online exams and an optional final used to replace lowest exam score. There are, however, several 4 to 6 page papers to do throughout the semester.

Dr. Mitchelsons class was the easiest class I have taken. His lectures are great and he really cares about the students! And you can tell that. Attendance isnt mandatory and its a hybrid class so all of the assignments are online. A bunch of practice quizzes (all on quizlet), 4 tests (drops lowest), and two essays. TAKE HIM! Easy A.

He is my favorite professor so far. You do journals every week due on the same day so it is easy to stay on track. He throws some practice quizzes in that are open all weekend that prepare you before the exam (only a couple). All the answers from the practice quizzes are the same so if you do your work and study that easy A. Non mandatory

write 2 paragraphs a week about how you FELT about the reading assigned (takes about 20 min). attendance only mandatory on tests. 3 tests overall. no midterm. final isn't mandatory. very strict on due dates. lots of assignments due over the break. stay on top of your work and turn it in on time for an A.

Professor Mitchelson is probably the best professor I've ever had. I was in a large class but he genuinely cared about everyone there. He obviously enjoys his job and wants to make sure his class enjoys their time too. I don't know where he finds the time to give such in depth personal feedback on every assignment but it definitely is appreciated.

This class is super easy. Professor Mitchelson gives you all you need to pass, rubrics, practice quizzes before test (has all the test answers). He wants you to pass. Great teacher and loves what he does.

Exams 3, Final Essays 2, Journals 5, Class exercises 4, Practice quizzes, Gen Ed Assessment 1, Discussion Boards. Exams are exact practice quizzes so save your answers. Super easy A, I did most of my stuff night before. Class exercises can be tricky b/c he uses random websites and ask questions. Would take again, left with a 100.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: A good teacher, and a better man. one of the most caring professors I've had so far at KSU. There's a decent amount of work, but it's not hard, and he is more than happy to help you if you are struggling. Would definitely recommend taking him.

He is a fair grader and wants you to do well. He provides a plan or a schedule so you always know what you need to do and get it done by then. I did the online summer class and he made it very do-able. He's also very nice and encouraging. None of his assignments are just "busy work," nor are they over the top and too time consuming.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Mitchelson was very good at having a clear set up for the class. I took it in the summer so we only had 1 month, but I was able to know everything I had to do ahead of time. Only used the textbook for Discussion Posts. The quizzes are free grades and exams are copied from them. He is easy to get in touch with and grades fast.

This is the first Rate My Professor I have completed where I have marked "Inspirational." Take this professor. He will open your eyes and you will have loads of fun! A journal and a quiz every two weeks; a short paper every few weeks; and then one final paper exam in the end.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: I took Professor Mitchelson online for GEO1101 as a summer semester and did not regret it. It's a lot of work, but not impossible. The journals are easy and the tests are straight from the quizzes, but you have to stay on track with reading the chapters every week. He's very accessible. I would definitely take him again!

Class is 7 quizzes (avg out of 5 attempts), 8 journals (easy A), 3 discussions, 4 short assignments and 2 final essays. Short assignments are kind of tough and he expects a lot out of them. BUT if you feel like you're falling behind, email him immediately! I thought I would get a D, but he helped me tremendously and I got a B. He truly cares!!!

You really got to be on top of your stuff. Quizzes are challenging, and the short essays can be tricky. But he's a very helpful and caring professor who wants all of his students to do well. He gives quality feedback on assignments, applauds your strengths, and gives great constructive criticism on any weaknesses. I'd love to take him again

Not only a great teacher but also an amazing person. He really cares about his students, he learned our names, and he really works hard so you have every opportunity to do well. It was an 8am class so my attendance was poor but I studied hard and got an A. Go to class, study the ppts, and there is no reason you can't do really well.

He's super laid back and an easy grader. If you take a summer class though, be prepared to read! You'll have up to 4 chapters a week if you take a 4-week session. He seems like he'd be a cool dude if you took a lecture class with him.

Quizzes are pretty difficult. Journals, discussions, and short assignments - just put in the work. HOWEVER he is so helpful. I had to email him about how I had fallen behind and asked him what my options were. He was clear about the options and offered more help than most other professors would.

Dr. Mitchelson really cares about his students and will often ask students' inputs on how the course should go. His quizzes and tests were online, making them open note. The labs, however, were not as fun, but he will take the time to help if you need it.  He has a great personality, and is very knowledgeable. Highly recommended!

Interesting class-- more so than I expected really.  Dr. Mitchelson is enthusiastic and loves to lecture geography.  I'd definitely recommend him for any of his lecture classes.  His tests are sometimes tricky and he IS a hard grader, but you get the opportunity for "curve points" if you show up the class after the exam.

Professor Mitchelson is always serious, yet very entertaining.  He really likes teaching.  He seeks to go beyond the course work and reach people in a larger context.  The movies were great in illustrating learning points.  The tests are not easy however he grades very fairly.  You will learn a LOT if you stay engaged-- thinking IS required.
This semester Professor Mitchelson was off his game. His tests are hard, but he curved a lot! Do not make him mad or challenge his authority, you will be hated forever!

I liked the subject matter in Political Geog., but the lectures could have been more through. It felt like class time was often used for stalling purposes. Tests were difficult, but he graded fairly. Expect to study a lot and know material. He was respectful of students at least. His intentions were good, but his teaching was often unclear or vague

Professor Mitchelson is very respectful of his students.  I don't think I've ever had a professor come into the room and right off say "It's an honor to be able to teach you".  Beware:  his exams are challenging and he is a hard grader.  Expect to study all the material and know it well-- sometimes from non-traditonal standpoints.

He's always willing to help and hear what students have to say. And his powerpoints aren't insanely cluttered like most professors'! There's a ton of material, but it's important content that everyone should have a dose of.

Econ. Geog. should be a mandatory class for all business, I.A., Geog majors. This class will be one of your favorites and most memorable. Dr. Mitchelson is a great lecturer and a great person. The subject is vast, however Dr. Mitchelson condenses the material into a manageable and insightful dose. Tests are very detailed, but not very difficult.

Dr. Mitchelson is awesome! I took his Urban Geo class b/c it was recommended by a friend. Thoroughly enjoyed it! He welcomes debates and is totally passionate about subject matter. Makes students feel comfortable and their opinions important.

what an awesome guy! relates to and engages students well. exams are not easy, but if you apply yourself and study you can do well. his lectures are really interesting. you actually want to go to class! take any section he is teaching, its worth it.
Fun and engaging professor, always willing to engage in friendly debate. Enthusiastic to a fault. Fairly challenging tests but does grade on a slight curve. Highly recommended.

Dr. Mitchelson wants to be liked, end of story. His class his straight forward, but tests will challenge you, though the majority of questions are multiple choice. The best way to study for tests is to look at all the trivia information on ppts such as what country produces the most of "xxx."  Final is take home, no study guide, don't buy textbook.
